task_summary: Detect, grasp, and lift the white carton from the tabletop, then hold briefly and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator operates over a curved white table containing multiple small objects: cans, bottles, a pink cylinder, and a small white carton on the right side. The goal is to raise the white carton vertically off the surface. The robot must perceive the target, approach from above, compute a top grasp, close the gripper, confirm possession, lift by a short distance, briefly stabilize the hold, and retreat slightly to clear the workspace.
preconditions: Robot is homed and within reach of the tabletop.
White carton is present and unobstructed.
Gripper functioning and free of objects.
Camera provides view of the scene.
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and move above the carton.
Compute a top grasp and execute grasp pose.
Close gripper and verify the object is in gripper.
Raise the held carton by 10 cm.
Hold/stabilize for 1 s and retreat 5 cm.
success_criteria: White carton is securely in the gripper.
Object is lifted approximately 10 cm above the table without dropping.
Robot retreats slightly while holding the object.
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure: re-run detection and small viewpoint adjustment.
Grasp slip: reopen, re-approach, recompute grasp, retry.
Collision detected: abort motion and retreat to a safe height.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after retreating with the carton held stably for the specified duration.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Perceive the white carton using onboard vision.
Move to a pregrasp pose above the carton.
Plan a top-down grasp and store pose.
Close gripper to secure the carton.
Lift the held carton by 10 cm.
Back off slightly to clear the workspace.

failure_modes: Target not detected due to occlusion.
Grasp fails because of misalignment or low friction.
Collision with nearby objects during approach.
recovery_strategy: Re-run DetectObject and re-approach from above.
Recompute grasp pose with same strategy and retry.
Open gripper and retreat to a safe height before the next attempt.
assumptions: The 'white carton' corresponds to the small white box-like object at the right side of the table.
Top grasp is feasible; the carton has graspable surfaces.
Contact sheet frames are slightly blurred; exact pose inferred from arrangement.

expected_success_criteria: RaiseHeld completes full 0.10 m lift without fault.
No collisions or drops observed during retreat.
